data.title: Mouse wheel scroll deadzone on MacOS Sierra

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When using a 3rd party mouse with a scroll wheel, scrolling below the speed neccessary to accelerate to 1 line per tick or faster will not trigger scrolling.

In macOS scrolling at a speed below a certain treshold will use pseudo-per-pixel scrolling with acceleration eventually bumping it to 1 line per tick and faster, depending on the speed.

Using a 3rd party mouse driver such as SteerMouse and setting the scroll speed to a fixed 1 line / tick or higher fixes the issue.

This behaviour isn't exhibited in other Electron apps tested (Slack, Zeplin, Caprine, Discord) or in Google Chrome.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0

data.title: JSDoc syntax highlight. Not supported type '...*'
data.body:
- VSCode Version:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20135773/90c6cff4-a682-11e6-966f-848580ab35ba.png)

- OS Version: win7 pro

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm used a Google Closure-Type notation:
https://github.com/google/closure-compiler/wiki/Types-in-the-Closure-Type-System#template-types

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20135975/a625b9d6-a683-11e6-807d-d027ed7b5599.png)

Make JSDoc comments:

Not highlighted type and the argument name:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20135849/f96b098a-a682-11e6-9222-74c46cf02314.png)

And how it works:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20135869/14ca28f0-a683-11e6-833b-7535e78390d4.png)

And so:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20135877/243e41a4-a683-11e6-8035-9f6b51536d08.png)

In the example from Google:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20136076/156f7ebc-a684-11e6-9de3-3929639ca550.png)

I think `{function(this:T, ...)}` a wrong. Must be `{function(this:T, ...*)}`, but so, too, does not work

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20136156/761a1222-a684-11e6-8aed-4cef9c552aa4.png)

And so, too, does not work

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3082812/20136267/e335f5f6-a684-11e6-8fbe-56ac357656b3.png)

In Sublime Text settings we can set the indent_to_bracket option to indent the code to the starting bracket. What is the equal option for visual studio code settings.json?

data.title: Selections broke after deleting text using vscode.TextEditor.edit
Is an extension able to contribute menu items dynamically?
data.body:
I want to create an extension which shows custom `explorer/context` menus for some special project folder structure. Is that possible?

For Sublime plugin I could define `is_visible` method on a command to decide if the menu item is shown. But I didn't see equivalent mechanism in vscode. The similar one is `when` clause but it's not powerful enough to do it.

data.title: Add command to 'Switch to Changes View' and 'Switch to Editor View'

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Feature request: Add a keyboard bind-able command for the actions 'Switch to Changes View' and 'Switch to Editor View'.

From what I can see, these actions are only accessible by mouse in the top tight corner of the file being edited. In order to see the changes view for the file being edited with the keyboard only, one must open the git bar, then use tab, arrows and enter to switch to the 'Changes View' for the certain file.

data.title: Build succeeded after failed npm install for an extension
data.body:
In today's insiders build on Windows:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/20131771/d5c955cc-a65f-11e6-8a18-a3b904cc3127.png)

I get the following error on startup:
```
extensionHost.ts:289[Extension Host] Activating extension `vscode.extension-editing` failed: Cannot find module 'typescript'.x.logExtensionHostMessage @ extensionHost.ts:289
extensionHost.ts:289[Extension Host] Activating extension `vscode.extension-editing` failed:  Cannot find module 'typescript'x.logExtensionHostMessage @ extensionHost.ts:289
extensionHost.ts:289[Extension Host] Here is the error stack:  Error: Cannot find module 'typescript'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:455:15)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:403:25)
    at Function.N.f._load (c:\Alex\Programs\Microsoft VS Code Insiders\resources\app\out\vs\workbench\node\extensionHostProcess.js:12:24608)
    at Module.require (module.js:483:17)
    at require (internal/module.js:20:19)

    at tryModuleLoad (module.js:432:12)
mainThreadExtensionService.ts:103Activating extension `vscode.extension-editing` failed: Cannot find module 'typescript'.
```

data.title: Provide workbench.action.nextEditor/previousEditor that cycle through current active group
data.body:
### Feature Request
As per this [comment in #7664](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7664#issuecomment-226469230), would like the ability to cycle through only the selected group. Currently it cycles through all editors in all groups. This isn't how it works in other editors like Sublime and is quite a bit counter intuitive.

data.title: [i18n] Improve jpn locale
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1
In  `vscode/i18n/jpn/src/vs/editor/contrib/goToDeclaration/browser/goToDeclaration.i18n.json`
```
	"actions.previewDecl.label": "",
```
It should be
```
	"actions.previewDecl.label": "",
```
Translation of [Visual Studio 2015](https://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/library/dn160178.aspx) looks good.
Are you using different translation in Visual Studio Code?

data.title: Add function preview summary window to editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Ent

In netbeans, there is an internal panel that will show you all the classes and functions that are found in the file currently with the focus, if you click on the function or the class within the panel, it will take you right to the defining line in the file.
I find this so extremely useful for when you are searching through a file for any given function or just overlooking the file contents. This is an easy way to look at all the classes and their members that have been defined in the file. That for programming languages,
For HTML, CSS for example it will show the file tree and the classes. This a pretty smart file preview.
It'd be nice to have this feature in VSC as well.

data.title: Fix Markdown Colorization of Indented Block Quotes
data.body:
Issue #12948

**Bug**
- Block quotes are not colorized if they start with a space. Up to three spaces should be supported (4 spaces makes it a code block)
- The second line of blocks quotes should be able to have any number of leading spaces.

**Fix**
Add support for both of these cases

![screen shot 2016-11-08 at 3 56 52 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20122367/ff3f55b2-a5cb-11e6-81e1-e0125bab27b4.png)


Closes #12948

data.title: SCSS highlighter loses track with & and string interpolation
Add yaml front matter support for Markdown
data.body:
Issue #2640

## Bug
We currently do not handle yaml front matter inside markdown files very well. In the editor, front matter  is incorrectly colorized as markdown, and the html preview tries to render the front matter as markdown content.

![screen shot 2016-11-08 at 3 39 18 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20122036/ac7a17b0-a5c9-11e6-9ebd-c2f93954c429.png)

## Fix
- Add grammar support for recognizing and tokenizing yaml front matter inside markdown files.
- Add an option to strip the yaml front matter from the html preview.

![screen shot 2016-11-08 at 3 40 12 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/20122044/b4972f8c-a5c9-11e6-9fb8-e460f663e6a4.png)


Closes #2640

data.title: "Switching to" Release Notes editor, even if it is already open, causes it to reload.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:53:14.822Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14959
- Extensions: (running with --disable-extensions)

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|rewrap|stkb|0.6.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Help > Release Notes
2. After it loads, click on the already-visible Release Notes tab => reloads the tab
3. Try using Ctrl+Tab to switch to the tab for the already-visible Release Notes editor => reloads
4. Try using the Open Editors panel to click on the already-open Release Notes tab => reloads

Expected behavior:

If nothing has changed (no change in which editor view is opened, and the content has not changed), there is no need for a reload. Even if a different editor is displayed and the content has not changed (and is all static and present on disk), a reload should not be necessary.

Notes:

The markdown preview has the behavior that when you click on or "switch to" the already opened view, it does not reload. However, if you switch away from it and back, it reloads dynamic content (like images hosted online).

data.title: Remove jsconfig.json lightbulb hint
data.body:
Issue #15205

**Bug**
Typescript now infers the js project if no `jsconfig.json` is found. This means that the light bulb hint about creating a `jsconfig.json` file is not required.

**Fix**
Remove the `jsconfig.json` light bulb logic.

closes #15205

data.title: Add a setting to disable gpu acceleration
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1-1478180561
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04 LTS
more info: 
Guest OS using VM on VirtualBox 5.0.26, 
Guest Additions installed, 
unity_support_test reports Unity 3D supported = yes (everything is lit up with green yes)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start VSCode.  This can be when docked in Launcher or launched via GUI or launched from command line
2. Window appears, screen stays black.  There might be grey rectangles or a blinking cursor, moving the window usually results in tearing.

**Workaround**
Launch from command line with `code . --disable-gpu`
If first window is launched this way, subsequent windows launched by any method follow option of currently open window(s)

**Proposed Workaround**
Once I identify that this machine can't run VSCode effectively without `--disable-gpu`, can we have a way to add to settings.json and be done with it?

Thank you for consideration
